question.title: Get more information from User - Spring Security

node.contents: I have implemented Spring Security in my application. I have used default implementation, i.e., I have configured it with my own parameters (DataSource, Secured Areas, etc), but I haven't write any Custom implementation.

astNode.text: I have implemented Spring Security in my application. I have used default implementation, i.e., I have configured it with my own parameters (DataSource, Secured Areas, etc), but I haven't write any Custom implementation.

node.contents: Now I want to capture more data from the user, that is on the same table as username and password, like company name, id, etc. However, I don't want do use this information in order to login.

astNode.text: Now I want to capture more data from the user, that is on the same table as username and password, like company name, id, etc. However, I don't want do use this information in order to login.

node.contents: I'm not sure how to do it. From what I've read, it's related to UserDetailsService. However, it seems that writing a Custom UserDetailsService would be necessary if I wanted to use this information during the login, and that's not what I want. I just want to use this information inside the application, after the user have logged in.

astNode.text: I'm not sure how to do it. From what I've read, it's related to UserDetailsService. However, it seems that writing a Custom UserDetailsService would be necessary if I wanted to use this information during the login, and that's not what I want. I just want to use this information inside the application, after the user have logged in.

node.contents: Is it really related to UserDetailsServer? Is this the only file I have to modificate?

astNode.text: Is it really related to UserDetailsServer? Is this the only file I have to modificate?

node.contents: All the examples I found of custom UserDetailsService just used username and password, so I can't understand where new data would come in.

astNode.text: All the examples I found of custom UserDetailsService just used username and password, so I can't understand where new data would come in.

node.contents: `loadUserByUsername` returns UserDetails, but in the code, it returns `buildUserFromAccount` that returns a User. So, how the CustomUserDetails is involved in the code? The Account DAO class and all it's methods should be implemented by me, correct?

astNode.text: `loadUserByUsername` returns UserDetails, but in the code, it returns `buildUserFromAccount` that returns a User. So, how the CustomUserDetails is involved in the code? The Account DAO class and all it's methods should be implemented by me, correct?

node.contents: Had a little typo in it and fixed it. To explain further: `UserDetails` is the interface, `User` is spring-securities implementation including all basic fields. If you want to add your own fields, the easiest thing to do is to extend `User`. You can still return a `User` object in that method or a `UserDetails` object or a `CustomUserDetails` object as spring security just expects an object that implements `UserDetails`.

astNode.text: Had a little typo in it and fixed it. To explain further: `UserDetails` is the interface, `User` is spring-securities implementation including all basic fields. If you want to add your own fields, the easiest thing to do is to extend `User`. You can still return a `User` object in that method or a `UserDetails` object or a `CustomUserDetails` object as spring security just expects an object that implements `UserDetails`.

node.contents: Ah, Ok! So using this, I'm providing everyting Spring Security needs to authenticate. However, the User object it holds has all my custom fields. So, how do I get this object, so I can `getCompany` for example?

astNode.text: Ah, Ok! So using this, I'm providing everyting Spring Security needs to authenticate. However, the User object it holds has all my custom fields. So, how do I get this object, so I can `getCompany` for example?

node.contents: Overriding the UserDetailsService is what we did.. You'll need to implement your own UserDetailsService and your own UserDetails object:

astNode.text: Overriding the UserDetailsService is what we did.. You'll need to implement your own UserDetailsService and your own UserDetails object:

elements.contents: public class CustomService implements UserDetailsService { @Transactional(readOnly = true) public UserDetails loadUserByUsername(String username) { Account account = accountDAO.findAccountByName(username); if (account == null) { throw new UsernameNotFoundException("account name not found"); } return buildUserFromAccount(account); } @SuppressWarnings("unchecked") @Transactional(readOnly = true) private User buildUserFromAccount(Account account) { String username = account.getUsername(); String password = account.getPassword(); boolean enabled = account.getEnabled(); boolean accountNonExpired = account.getAccountNonExpired(); boolean credentialsNonExpired = account.getCredentialsNonExpired(); boolean accountNonLocked = account.getAccountNonLocked(); // additional information goes here String companyName = companyDAO.getCompanyName(account); Collection<GrantedAuthority> authorities = new ArrayList<GrantedAuthority>(); for (Role role : account.getRoles()) { authorities.add(new SimpleGrantedAuthority(role.getName())); } CustomUserDetails user = new CustomUserDetails (username, password, enabled, accountNonExpired, credentialsNonExpired, accountNonLocked, authorities, company); return user; } public class CustomUserDetails extends User{ // ... public CustomUserDetails(..., String company){ super(...); this.company = company; } private String company; public String getCompany() { return company;} public void setCompany(String company) { this.company = company;} }

comments.text: // additional information goes here String companyName = companyDAO.getCompanyName(account); Collection<GrantedAuthority> authorities = new ArrayList<GrantedAuthority>(); for (Role role : account.getRoles()) { authorities.add(new SimpleGrantedAuthority(role.getName())); } CustomUserDetails user = new CustomUserDetails (username, password, enabled, accountNonExpired, credentialsNonExpired, accountNonLocked, authorities, company); return user; } public class CustomUserDetails extends User{ // ... public CustomUserDetails(..., String company){ super(...); this.company = company; } private String company; public String getCompany() { return company;} public void setCompany(String company) { this.company = company;} }
